text: You'd be better off looking into code bundling and storing all your workflow custom code in a dedicated repo. Calling a serverless function to have access to additional libraries isn't a great practice.

It's fairly common in the world of serverless to bundle and minify your code to avoid cold starts etc.

For UI Extensions everything is automatically bundled via vite, for serverless of any kind you should look into rollup/webpack/esbuild
Its for setting up XML feeds, a client is looking to relay data to different listing websites they want to showcase their offer on and building platforms all share a similar schema powered by XML
Hi Hugo, I've forwarded the feedback to the team internally and they are already aware of the limitations. I will keep you posted on where this lands.

Hi all!
Is it possible to use native HTML elements in UI extension? It seems that I can use only the components from `@HubSpot/ui-extensions` library.
